intro: Kentrophyllum tingitanum, commonly known as the Moroccan rockrose, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of North Africa. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit. The plant features small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in summer, often in clusters at the ends of its branches. Its leaves are narrow and covered in fine hairs, adapting to the arid and saline conditions of its habitat. Kentrophyllum tingitanum is well-suited to rocky and coastal environments, making it a hardy species in Mediterranean climates.
